intro: Malleastrum obovatum, commonly known as the broad-ovate malleastrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
